TopicTitle: Oh look, EA is learning something!

Articles.Content:
EA just released a ''Humble Origin Bundle'' Where you get Dead Space, Burnout Paradise Ultimate Box, Crysis 2 Maximum Edition, Mirror's Edge, Dead Space 3 and Medal of Honor for and price you want (As long as it's over 1$) and if you pay over the average, you get BF3 and The Sims 3 plus 2 other expansion packs. You could save up to 214$ (If you're paying 1$) by buying this, AND the money goes for charity. EA, keep doing this, and people will like. And like someone else have said;

''This deal is amazing and EA don't get a penny for it.''

Some of them, yea. And I almost forgot, the link. https://www.humblebundle.com/ If one didn't know.

Well, EA gets no money off this one, it all goes to Charity,

And of the games available, Dead Space, Burnout Paradise: The Ultimate Box, Crysis 2 Maximum Edition, Medal of Honor, and Mirror's Edge all provide Steam Keys so you don't have to go thru Origin

(unlike other Humble Bundle no direct downloads are available on Origin or Steam)

This language is due to the way Humble Bundle works.

Humble Bundle is always split between the Humble Bundle team, The developers, and Charity, and you adjust sliders to set how much (if anything) goes to them.

In this case EA has elected to now be present on the sliders you cannot give to EA, only to charity and Humble Bundle team.

It does sound confusing but when you know how Humble Bundle works it makes more sense. I bought it, and it adjusted my sliders to give to which charities I wanted and nothing was provided to EA or origin, don't worry.

Read my earlier post about how Humble Bundle works to see this is completely not what's going on here.

Basically EA gave games to Humble Bundle free of charge. HumbleBundle is now selling you those games and giving the money to charity. You pick how much and which charity. It's a win win.

HumbleBundle is a fantasic charitable organization that has done a lot for indie game developers and for charity. Lets let them get the press they deserve.
